page.title: 04NATIONAL TRUST GARDENS-HOLT
page.content: The Courts has seven acres of land. It is open Monday to Friday from April 1st till October 31st. The entrance fee is Â£1, but the residents of Holt are allowed in free of charge. The house is no longer open to the public although the gardens are. The Courts has 300 types of cultivated plants and 43 types of moiled (naturally grown) plants. There are some rare plants; for example, a rose called Salmon Spray and a tree called the Italian Cypress. There are a number of interesting hedges in the grounds, one of which is shaped in the form of dancing bears. The National Trust spends about Â£15,300 p.a. on plants and machinery and the gardeners work even when the grounds are open. The average number of visitors per year is about 4,500 people.
